messages.message:
Hi all, there will be a small modification to your Python ibfile usage after this change: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/13361/files#diff-3f5222920528495cc5c12aaa0008b6f1R113

If you plan to read or write binary, you must use the binary mode bit, e.g., ‘rb’ or ‘wb’
If you plan to read or write str, you must use the str mode bit, e.g., ‘r’,  ‘w’

We have much stricter typing now, so you might see errors that you didn’t see before.
Note: this doesn’t affect customers or UDFs because we don’t type check their code.

In a short period of time, we will have support for the ‘encoding’ argument, where you can specify your custom encoding when reading and writing files in str mode cc: @Karthik S @Mohit @Ashish
